name: 3SUM Closure
statement: You are given an array $$$a$$$ of length $$$n$$$. The array is called 3SUM-closed if for all distinct indices $$$i$$$, $$$j$$$, $$$k$$$, the sum $$$a_i + a_j + a_k$$$ is an element of the array. More formally, $$$a$$$ is 3SUM-closed if for all integers $$$1 \leq i < j < k \leq n$$$, there exists some integer $$$1 \leq l \leq n$$$ such that $$$a_i + a_j + a_k = a_l$$$. Determine if $$$a$$$ is 3SUM-closed.
inputFormat: The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 1000$$$) — the number of test cases. The first line of each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$3 \leq n \leq 2 \cdot 10^5$$$) — the length of the array. The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$ ($$$-10^9 \leq a_i \leq 10^9$$$) — the elements of the array. It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ across all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, output " YES " (without quotes) if $$$a$$$ is 3SUM-closed and " NO " (without quotes) otherwise. You can output " YES " and " NO " in any case (for example, strings " yEs ", " yes " and " Yes " will be recognized as a positive response).
